title: Video Analysis of ICE Shooting Sheds Light on Contested Moments
summary: Newly available videos and existing footage synchronized and assessed by The Times provides a millisecond by millisecond look at how an ICE officer ended up shooting and killing a motorist in Minneapolis.

title: Was Renee Good Obligated to Comply With an ICE Agent’s Orders?
summary: The agent told Ms. Good to get out of her car before she was fatally shot. Legal experts said immigration agents may sometimes, but not always, have the authority to make such commands.

title: Did a Supreme Court Loss Embolden Trump on the Insurrection Act?
summary: In refusing to let the president deploy National Guard troops in Illinois under an obscure law, the justices may have made him more apt to invoke greater powers.

title: U.S. Says It Erred in Deporting Student Traveling for Thanksgiving
summary: The Trump administration acknowledged it mistakenly deported a college student to Honduras despite a court order barring the removal. But the government has not moved to drop the case.

title: Machado Presents Trump With Nobel Peace Prize
summary: The Venezuelan opposition leader’s efforts to share her award with the U.S. president have shaken some Norwegians’ faith in their signature soft-power tool.

title: Venezuela’s Interim Leader Delivers State of the Union Address
summary: In her State of the Union address, Delcy Rodríguez echoed her predecessors’ fiery rhetoric but tried to hew to President Trump’s agenda.

title: U.S. Forces Seize Sixth Oil Tanker Linked to Venezuela
summary: The Coast Guard boarded and seized the Russian-flagged tanker, originally named Veronica, in a pre-dawn operation in the Caribbean Sea.

title: Battles Over Truth Rage Online Amid Iran’s Internet Blackout
summary: The shutdown of online discourse within Iran has allowed both the government and its critics to flood social media outside the country with disinformation campaigns and fake images.

title: How Activists in Iran Are Using Starlink to Stay Online
summary: Activists spent years preparing for a communications blackout in Iran, smuggling in Starlink satellite internet systems and making digital shutdowns harder for the authorities to enforce.

title: Israel and Arab Nations Ask Trump to Refrain From Attacking Iran
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel asked the president to postpone any planned attack. Israeli and Arab officials fear Iran could retaliate by striking their countries.

title: Many Fiery Remarks, Little Clarity on What’s Next at Security Council Meeting on Iran
summary: Iran’s representative denied the country had killed protesters, as the U.S. ambassador said President Trump had made clear “all options are on the table” to stop the killing.

title: Taiwan Strikes Trade Deal with Trump, Vows More U.S. Chip Factories
summary: The United States agreed to lower tariffs on Taiwanese goods from 20 to 15 percent, while Taiwan says it will invest in more chip manufacturing in the U.S.

title: Trump Administration Lawsuit Seeking California Voter Data Is Dismissed
summary: The Justice Department has sued about two dozen states over access to voter rolls, as the federal government pushes to create a national database.

title: What Did the White House and Denmark Agree to on Greenland? Depends Whom You Ask.
summary: The White House and Denmark contradicted each other in public about what they had agreed to this week as President Trump continued to demand U.S. ownership of Greenland.

title: Pentagon Will ‘Refocus’ Military Publication Stars and Stripes
summary: The agency’s chief spokesman outlined plans to intervene in the previously independent newspaper’s coverage.

title: Former Senator Kyrsten Sinema Accused of Affair With Member of Security Team
summary: In a lawsuit, the ex-wife of Ms. Sinema’s onetime staff member accused her of showering him with gifts and breaking up their marriage.

title: None of Mamdani’s Deputy Mayors Are Black. It Has Become a Problem.
summary: Some Black and Latino leaders worry they are being denied access to power under Mayor Zohran Mamdani and that they may lose the ground they had gained under former Mayor Eric Adams.

title: Number of Businesses in New York City Plunged Last Spring, Report Says
summary: Roughly 8,400 businesses closed in the second quarter of 2025, according to the most recent city data, creating the largest net decline in business activity since before the pandemic.

title: Nydia Velázquez Gives Mamdani a Warning as She Endorses a Successor
summary: The veteran congresswoman said she would like Antonio Reynoso, the Brooklyn borough president, to replace her after she retires. She also said the mayor should stay out of political races.

title: Why Trump Always Thanks You ‘For Your Attention to This Matter’
summary: How a simple catchphrase sums up the president’s theory of executive power.

title: Uber’s Quest to Crack Japan Leads Through a Rural Hot-Springs Town
summary: The ride-hailing giant’s chief executive has made a bet on how it can finally grab a bigger piece of one of the world’s largest taxi markets.

title: Nick Reiner Was in a Mental Health Conservatorship in 2020
summary: Mr. Reiner, who is accused of killing his parents, was under a yearlong legal arrangement that allows for involuntary psychiatric treatment.

title: The Truth About Weight-Loss Drugs Like Ozempic: You Probably Need Them Forever
summary: Many people who use these medications don’t want to stay on them long term. But research has repeatedly shown that quitting the drugs means gaining back weight.

title: Iran’s Regime Is Losing Its Greatest Weapon: Fear
summary: The bulwark of Iranian oppression is fear. The latest round of demonstrations shows it has been breached.

title: 2 Polling Experts on How the ICE Shooting Is More Trouble for Trump
summary: The general sense of the world being chaotic does not necessarily help Trump.

title: Trump Threatened to Send the Military to Minneapolis
summary: Also, Israel and Arab countries asked the U.S. not to attack Iran. Here’s the latest at the end of Thursday.

title: Hesitant to Visit the U.S. for the World Cup? We Want to Hear From You.
summary: International soccer fans face hurdles like travel bans, long visa delays and high ticket prices for U.S. matches. Will they be enough to keep you away?

title: Alexander Brothers Accuser Was Found Dead Last Year, Authorities Say
summary: The death of Kate Whiteman, whose accusation of sexual assault against Oren and Alon Alexander opened a floodgate of similar allegations, is under investigation.

title: Leonard D. Jacoby, 83, Dies; Brought Legal Services to the Masses
summary: He and Steven Z. Meyers opened their first low-cost legal clinic in 1972. Within a decade, they had revolutionized the legal industry, and Jacoby & Meyers had become a widely known brand.

title: California’s Pacific Coast Highway Fully Reopens After Three Years
summary: The famed highway reopened this week after consecutive landslides shuttered two sections of the road in Big Sur and forced major repairs.
